translated: The Great Staff Dhāraṇī, the Cool One
Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: evaṃ mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma /
analyzed: evam mayā śrutam ekasmin samaye bhagavān rājagṛhe viharati sma
translated: Thus have I heard. At one time the Blessed One was dwelling in Rājagṛha,
in the Cool Grove, in the great cremation ground, in the vicinity of the Iṅghikā shrine.

original: tatrāyuṣmān rāhulo 'tīva viheṭhyate devagrahair nāgagrahair yakṣagrahai rākṣasagrahaiḥ
analyzed: tatra āyuṣmān rāhulo tīva viheṭhyate deva grahaiḥ nāga grahaiḥ yakṣa grahaiḥ rākṣasa grahaiḥ
translated: There the Venerable Rāhula was greatly afflicted by devagrahas, nāgagrahas, yakṣagrahas, rākṣasagrahas,

analyzed: kinnara grahaiḥ garuḍa grahaiḥ mahoraga grahaiḥ manuṣya grahaiḥ amanuṣya grahaiḥ preta grahaiḥ
translated: kiṃpuruṣagrahas, garuḍagrahas, mahoragagrahas, manujaagrahas, amanujaagrahas, pretaagrahas,

analyzed: bhūta grahaiḥ piśāca grahaiḥ kumbhāṇḍa grahaiḥ dvīpibhiḥ kākaiḥ ulūkaiḥ kīṭaiḥ sarīsṛpaiḥ
translated: bhūtaagrahas, piśācaagrahas, kumbhāṇḍagrahas, dīpis, crows, owls, insects, reptiles,

analyzed: anyaiḥ ca manuṣya amanuṣyaiḥ sattvaiḥ  atha āyuṣmān rāhulaḥ yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāntaḥ upasaṃkramya bhagavataḥ pādau
translated: and by other human and non-human beings.🔽Then the Venerable Rāhula approached the Blessed One, and having approached, he bowed his head at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: śirasābhivanditvā bhagavantaṃ tripradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ purato rudann aśrūṇi pravartayati sma /
analyzed: śirasā abhivanditvā bhagavantam tri pradakṣiṇīkṛtya bhagavataḥ puratas rudan aśrūṇi pravartayati sma
translated: circumambulated the Blessed One three times, and in front of the Blessed One he wept and shed tears.

original: atha bhagavān jānann eva rāhulam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha bhagavān jānan eva rāhulam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing very well, addressed Rāhula:

original: kiṃ tvaṃ rāhula mama purataḥ sthitvā aśrūṇi pravartayasi /
analyzed: kim tvam rāhula mama puratas sthitvā aśrūṇi pravartayasi
translated: Why are you, Rāhula, standing in front of me, shedding tears?

original: evam ukte āyuṣmān rāhulo bhagavantam etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte āyuṣmān rāhulaḥ bhagavantam etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Venerable Rāhula said this to the Blessed One:
Here, Blessed One, I dwell in Rājagṛha,
in the Śītavana Mahāśmaśāna, in the vicinity of the Iṅghika shrine.

original: so 'haṃ bhagavaṃs tatra viheṭhye devagrahair nāgagrahair yakṣagrahai rākṣasagrahaiḥ
analyzed: saḥ ham bhagavan tatra viheṭhye deva grahaiḥ nāga grahaiḥ yakṣa grahaiḥ rākṣasa grahaiḥ
translated: There, Blessed One, I am harassed by devagrahas, nāgagrahas, yakṣagrahas, rākṣasagrahas,

original: kinnaragrahair garuḍagrahair mahoragagrahair manuṣyagrahair amanuṣyagrahaiḥ pretagrahair
analyzed: kinnara grahaiḥ garuḍa grahaiḥ mahoraga grahaiḥ manuṣya grahaiḥ amanuṣya grahaiḥ preta grahaiḥ
translated: kiṃpuruṣagrahas, garuḍagrahas, mahoragagrahas, manujaagrahas, amanujaagrahas, pretaagrahas,

original: bhūtagrahaiḥ piśācagrahaiḥ kumbhāṇḍagrahair dvīpibhiḥ kākair ulūkaiḥ kīṭaiḥ sarīsṛpair
analyzed: bhūta grahaiḥ piśāca grahaiḥ kumbhāṇḍa grahaiḥ dvīpibhiḥ kākaiḥ ulūkaiḥ kīṭaiḥ sarīsṛpaiḥ
translated: bhūtaagrahas, piśācaagrahas, kumbhāṇḍagrahas, dīpis, crows, owls, insects, reptiles,

translated: and by other human and non-human beings.

original: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantaṃ rāhulam āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān āyuṣmantam rāhulam āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the Venerable Rāhula:

original: udgṛhṇa tvaṃ rāhula imāṃ mahādaṇḍadhāraṇīṃ vidyām /
analyzed: udgṛhṇa tvam rāhula imām mahā daṇḍadhāraṇīm vidyām
translated: You should memorize this Mahādaṇḍadhāraṇī Vidya, Rāhula.

original: catasṛṇāṃ parṣadāṃ rakṣāvaraṇaguptaye bhikṣūṇāṃ bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānāṃ ca dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: catasṛṇām parṣadām rakṣā āvaraṇa guptaye bhikṣūṇām bhikṣuṇīnām upāsakānām upāsikānām ca dīrgharātram arthāya hitāya sukhāya bhaviṣyati
translated: For the protection, defense, and safety of the four assemblies - the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers - it will be for their long-term benefit, welfare, and happiness.

analyzed: manmate utpale  kara vīre  tara vīre

translated: King Brahmā, lord of a thousand.
King Buddha Bhagavān, lord of the Dharma.

analyzed: mama sarva sattvānām ca rakṣām kurvantu
translated: May they make a protection for me and all beings.

original: paritrāṇaṃ parigrahaṃ paripālanaṃ śāntiṃ svastyayanaṃ daṇḍaparihāraṃ śastraparihāraṃ viṣadūṣaṇaṃ viṣanāśanaṃ sīmābandhaṃ dharaṇībandhaṃ ca
analyzed: paritrāṇam parigraham paripālanam śāntim svastyayanam daṇḍa parihāram śastra parihāram viṣa dūṣaṇam viṣa nāśanam sīmābandham dharaṇībandham ca
translated: May they make a rescue, a taking hold, a guarding, a peace, a well-being, an avoidance of punishment, an avoidance of weapons, a corruption of poison, a destruction of poison, a binding of the boundaries, and a binding of the earth.

analyzed: jīvatu varṣa śatam paśyatu śaradām śatam
translated: Live for a hundred years, see a hundred autumns.
Mind of the earth.🔽Mind of a hundred thousand.
Homage to the Blessed Buddhas, svāhā!

original: asyāṃ khalu rāhula mahādaṇḍadhāraṇyāṃ vidyāyām antaśo 'ṣṭottaraśatapadānāṃ sūtraṃ🔽granthiṃ baddhāyāṃ hastena dhāryamāṇāyāṃ kaṇṭhena dhāryamāṇāyāṃ samantād yojanaśatasya
analyzed: asyām khalu rāhula mahādaṇḍadhāraṇyām vidyāyām antaśas ṣṭottaraśata padānām sūtram  granthim baddhāyām hastena dhāryamāṇāyām kaṇṭhena dhāryamāṇāyām samantāt yojana śatasya
translated: In this great staff-bearing dhāraṇī, O Rāhula, even if one were to wear around one's neck or carry in one's hand a thread
with one hundred and eight knots, protection will have been made all around for one hundred yojanas.

original: gandhair vā puṣpair vā mudrābhir vā naiva manuṣyo vāmanuṣyo vābhibhaviṣyati /🔽na viṣaṃ na śastraṃ na rogo na jvaro na prajvaro na vidyāmantro na vetāḍaḥ /
analyzed: gandhaiḥ vā puṣpaiḥ vā mudrābhiḥ vā na eva manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā abhibhaviṣyati  na viṣam na śastram na rogaḥ na jvaraḥ na prajvaraḥ na vidyā mantraḥ na vetāḍaḥ
translated: One will not be overcome by humans or non-humans, by smells, flowers, or seals.🔽There will be no poison, no weapon, no disease, no fever, no epidemic, no spells, no demons,

original: na vyādhau nāgnau na viṣodakena kālaṃ kariṣyati /
analyzed: na vyādhau na agnau na viṣa udakena kālam kariṣyati
translated: no illness, no fire, no poisoned water that will cause death.

original: vidyāmantraprayogānāṃ ca sarveṣāṃ sādhuprayuktānāṃ ca bandhanī /
analyzed: vidyā mantra prayogānām ca sarveṣām sādhu prayuktānām ca bandhanī
translated: It is a binding of all the spells and mantras, and of all the well-employed ones.
It is a liberator from the bonds of others.

analyzed: sarva roga śoka vighna vināśana karī
translated: It destroys all diseases, sorrows, and obstacles.
It pacifies the defilements of the age of strife.
It liberates from all the planets.
If a planet does not release,

analyzed: saptadhā asya sphuṭet mūrdhā arjakasya iva mañjarī
translated: his head will split into seven pieces, like a jasmine flower.

original: vajrapāṇiś cāsya mahāyakṣasenāpatir vajreṇādīptena samprajvālitena ekajvālībhūtena dhyāyitvā mūrdhānaṃ sphoṭayet /
analyzed: vajrapāṇiḥ ca asya mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ vajreṇa ādīptena samprajvālitena ekajvālībhūtena dhyāyitvā mūrdhānam sphoṭayet
translated: And Vajrapāṇi, the great general of the yakṣas, will meditate with his blazing, fully blazing, and completely blazing vajra, and will split open his head.

original: catvāraś ca mahārājāno 'yomayena cakreṇa kṣuradhārāprahāreṇa vināśayeyuḥ /
analyzed: catvāraḥ ca mahā rājānaḥ yomayena cakreṇa kṣura dhārā prahāreṇa vināśayeyuḥ
translated: And the four great kings will destroy him with an iron wheel, without a blow from a razor's edge.
He will fall from the realm of the yakṣas.
He will not find a dwelling in the capital city of Aḍakavatī.🔽Rahula, when this Mahādaṇḍadhāraṇī Vidya is recited once, one who has entered the midst of all dangers -

original: asyāṃ khalu rāhula mahādaṇḍadhāraṇyāṃ vidyāyāṃ sakṛtparivartitāyāṃ rājacaurodakāgniviṣaśastrāṭavīkāntāraparvatadurgamadhyagataḥ sarvabhayebhyaḥ
analyzed: asyām khalu rāhula mahādaṇḍadhāraṇyām vidyāyām sakṛt parivartitāyām rāja caura udaka agni viṣa śastra aṭavī kāntāra parvata durga madhya gataḥ sarva bhayebhyaḥ
translated: whether from kings, thieves, water, fire, poison, weapons, forests, deserts, mountains, or inaccessible places -

original: iyaṃ khalu mahādaṇḍadhāraṇīvidyā ekanavatigaṅgānadīvālikāsamair buddhair bhāṣitā
analyzed: iyam khalu mahā daṇḍadhāraṇī vidyā ekanavati gaṅgā nadī vālikā samaiḥ buddhaiḥ bhāṣitā
translated: This Mahādaṇḍadhāraṇī Vidya was spoken by Buddhas equal to the sands of one hundred and nine Ganges Rivers,

analyzed: bhāṣyate bhāṣiṣyate ca siddhā parama siddhā sarva deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragābhiḥ
translated: is being spoken, and will be spoken. It is accomplished, supremely accomplished, and is revered by all gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas.
It is surrounded by all the multitudes of people.

original: sarvabhayopadraveṣu mama sarvasattvānāṃ ca śivam ārogyaṃ bhavatu /
analyzed: sarva bhaya upadraveṣu mama sarva sattvānām ca śivam ārogyam bhavatu
translated: In all fears and calamities, may there be peace and health for me and all beings.

original: idam avocad bhagavān āttamanā āyuṣmān rāhulo bhagavato bhāṣitam abhyanandann iti /
analyzed: idam avocat bhagavān ātta manāḥ āyuṣmān rāhulaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāṣitam abhyanandan iti
translated: The Blessed One said this. The Venerable Rahula was elated and rejoiced in the Blessed One's words.
The Noble Great Staff Dhāraṇī is completed.
